intro: Pseudabutilon rosei, commonly known as the roseleaf abutilon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual or perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers come in a range of colors, including pink, red, and white, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Pseudabutilon rosei thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, preferring temperate climates.
